propertyGroup.name: Outlets
propertyGroup.documentation: Defines the locations to which output is generated.

property.name: enumerations
property.documentation: The directory to which enumerations are generated.

property.name: entities
property.documentation: The directory to which hibernate entities are generated. Please NOTE that the entity implementation classes will also be generated to this location when no operations are present on the entity with instance scope.

property.name: entity-tools
property.documentation: The location to which entity tools files are generated.

property.name: entity-delegators
property.documentation: The location to which gorm entity delegators files are generated.

property.name: configuration
property.documentation: The directory to which the hibernate.cfg.xml file is generated.

property.name: cache
property.documentation: The directory to which the ehcache.xml file is generated.

property.name: service-interfaces
property.documentation: The location to which all service interfaces and common API classes such as default service exceptions will be generated.

property.name: services
property.documentation: The location to which all service classes (including the service locator(s)) will be generated.

property.name: service-impls
property.documentation: The location to which all service implementation classes will be generated.

property.name: unit-tests
property.documentation: The location to which all unit tests classes will be generated.

property.name: json
property.documentation: The location to which all json classes will be generated.

property.name: controllers
property.documentation: The directory to which all controllers base classes are generated.

property.name: controller-impls
property.documentation: The directory to which controllers implementation classes are generated.

property.name: views
property.documentation: The directory to which web flow state views are generated.

property.name: hibernateEnableCache
property.documentation: Enable/disable hibernate's second level cache features for the cartridge.

property.name: hibernateEnableDistributedCache
property.documentation:
If this property is set to true, distributed caching will be enabled. To enable distributed caching for an entity, you must set this property to true AND tag the entity using the tagged value @andromda.hibernate.entity.cache.distributed tagged value.
true
false

property.name: hibernateDistributedCacheMulticastPort
property.documentation: The multicast port to be used for multicast group communication when using a distributed cache provider (see hibernateEnableDistributedCache).

property.name: hibernateDistributedCacheMulticastAddress
property.documentation: The address to be used for multicast group communication when using a distributed cache provider (see hibernateEnableDistributedCache).

property.name: hibernateDistributedCacheSocketTimeout
property.documentation: The number of seconds client sockets will wait when sending messages to this listener until they give up.

property.name: hibernateEntityCache
property.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for Entities caching. Can be overwritten using the corresponding tagged value. Possible values are:
read-write
nonstrict-read-write
read-only

property.name: hibernateAssociationCache
property.documentation:
Defines the default strategy for associations between Entities caching. Can be overwrited with the corresponding tagged value. Possible values are:
read-write
nonstrict-read-write
read-only

property.name: hibernateUseQueryCache
property.documentation:
The default query cache usage. Can be overwritten using @andromda.hibernate.query.useCache. Possible values are:
true
false

property.name: hibernateEnableAssociationsCache
property.documentation: Enable/disable Hibernate's second level cache feature for entity associations. Please NOTE that hibernateEnableCache should also be enabled when specifying this property.

property.name: hibernateEhCacheDiskStore
property.documentation: Defines the path to the directory where cache files will be created

property.name: hibernateCacheProvider
property.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Cache Provider implementation class. Possible values for Hibernate2 are:
net.sf.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.JCSCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.SwarmCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.TreeCacheProvider
net.sf.hibernate.cache.OSCacheProvider
Possible values for Hibernate3 are:
org.hibernate.cache.EhCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.HashtableCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.JCSCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.SwarmCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.TreeCacheProvider
org.hibernate.cache.OSCacheProvider

property.name: hibernateQueryCacheFactory
property.documentation:
Defines Hibernate Query Cache Factory implementation class. Possible value for Hibernate2 is:
net.sf.hibernate.cache.StandardQueryCacheFactory
Possible value for Hibernate3 is:
org.hibernate.cache.StandardQueryCacheFactory

property.name: hibernateConnectionReleaseMode
property.documentation:
Specify when Hibernate should release JDBC connections. By default, a JDBC connection is held until the session is explicitly closed or disconnected. For an application server JTA datasource, you should use after_statement to aggressively release connections after every JDBC call. For a non-JTA connection, it often makes sense to release the connection at the end of each transaction, by using after_transaction. auto will choose after_statement for the JTA and CMT transaction strategies and after_transaction for the JDBC transaction strategy.
Valid values are:
on_close - default
after_transaction
after_statement
auto

property.name: ehCacheMaxElementsInMemory
property.documentation: Defines the default maximum number of objects that will be created in memory.

property.name: ehCacheEternal
property.documentation: Defines a default value for the eternal parameter.

property.name: ehCacheTimeToIdleSeconds
property.documentation: Defines the default time to idle for an element before it expires.

property.name: ehCacheTimeToLiveSeconds
property.documentation: Defines the default time to live for an element before it expires.

property.name: ehCacheOverflowToDisk
property.documentation: Defines the default value for the overflow to disk property.

property.name: driver
property.documentation: JDBC Driver to make database connection, this should be a fully qualified Java class name.

property.name: username
property.documentation: The database user login name.

property.name: password
property.documentation: The database user password.

property.name: connectionUrl
property.documentation: URL for the JDBC Driver to make the connection to the database.

property.name: dataSource
property.documentation: JNDI name of data source to use. (would be used instead of the connection properties, driver, username, password, etc).

property.name: hibernateShowSql
property.documentation: Whether or not to log SQL statements.

property.name: hibernateDialect
property.documentation: SQL dialect of the database.

property.name: hibernateMaxFetchDepth
property.documentation: Sets a maximum "depth" for the outer join fetch tree. Recommended values between 0 and 3

property.name: hibernateJdbcFetchSize
property.documentation: A non-zero value determines the JDBC fetch size

property.name: hibernateJdbcBatchSize
property.documentation: A nonzero value enables use of JDBC2 batch updates by Hibernate. Recommended values between 5 and 30

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseScrollableResultSet
property.documentation: Whether or not to enable use of JDBC2 scrollable resultsets by Hibernate. This property is only necessary when using user supplied connections. Hibernate uses connection metadata otherwise.

property.name: hibernateJdbcUseStreamsForBinary
property.documentation: Whether or not to use streams when writing / reading binary or serializable types to/from JDBC.

property.name: hibernateHbm2DDLAuto
property.documentation:
Automatically export schema DDL to the database when the SessionFactory is created. With create-drop, the database schema will be dropped when the SessionFactory is closed explicitely. Permitted values are:
update
create
create-drop
validate (since Hibernate 3)

property.name: hibernateQuerySubstitutions
property.documentation: Allows you to define new Hibernate query tokens. For example: giving this a value of true=1, false=0 would cause the tokens true and false to be translated to integer literals in the generated SQL.

property.name: sequenceIdentifierSuffix
property.documentation: The suffix to use for identifier sequences.

property.name: hibernateUseOuterJoin
property.documentation: Whether or not to use outer join.

property.name: entityNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an entity name. {0} is used to represent the entity name in the model, so if you specified a value of {0}Entity all the entities generated would have a suffix of "Entity".

property.name: entityImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the entity implementation name.

property.name: embeddedValueImplementationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing an embedded value implementation name.

property.name: enumerationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing hibernate enumerations.

property.name: ejbJndiNamePrefix
property.documentation: The prefix to give to the Session EJB JNDI names (this allows the same Session EJB to be deployed multiple times in the same container)

property.name: implementationOperationNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern used to the create the implementation operation name (i.e. the operations that actually perform the handling of the logic), where {0} represents the operation name

property.name: serviceOperationTransactionType
property.documentation: The default transaction type used for service operations (when not wrapping your services with EJBs). NOTE: Can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.spring.transaction.type tagged value.

property.name: hibernateTransactionFactoryClass
property.documentation: The name of the hibernate transaction factory class to use.

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerStrategy
property.documentation: Strategy for obtaining the JTA TransactionManager.

property.name: hibernateUserTransactionName
property.documentation: The JNDI name of the JTA UserTransaction object.

property.name: hibernateTransactionManagerLookup
property.documentation: The fully qualified class name of the Hibernate TransactionFactory implementation.

property.name: transactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring.

property.name: localTransactionManager
property.documentation: The transaction manager implementation used by Spring for the local datasource (applicationContextLocalDataSource).

property.name: userTransactionName
property.documentation: The (JNDI-) user transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

property.name: transactionManagerName
property.documentation: The (JNDI-) transaction manager of the J2EE container if using JTA transactions (via spring).

propertyGroup.name: Other
propertyGroup.documentation: Other various properties that couldn't be classified into another category.

property.name: optimisticLocking
property.documentation: Set to false to disable Optimistic locking

property.name: hibernateVersion
property.documentation:
The version of Hibernate to use when generating. Allowable values are:
2 - Hibernate 2.x
3 - Hibernate 3.x

property.name: hibernateXMLPersistence
property.documentation: Set to true to enable Hibernate's XML persistence support using dom4J. The hibernateVersion namespace property must be set to 3.

property.name: hibernateXMLPersistIDAsAttribute
property.documentation: Set to true if the identifier for generated entities should be mapped to an attribute of the entity's XML tag, or as a separate field when XML persistence support is enabled. The hibernateXMLPersistence namespace property must be set to true for this option to have meaning.

property.name: defaultHibernateGeneratorClass
property.documentation: The default class to use for Hibernate ID generation (can be overridden on a per entity basis with the @andromda.hibernate.generator.class tagged value).

property.name: hibernateDefaultCascade
property.documentation: The value of the default-cascade attribute of the hibernate entity XML mapping.

property.name: hibernateCompositionCascade
property.documentation:
Indicates how a UML composition should be interpreted as cascade.
If undefined, the cascade attribute is computed by AndroMDA in the following manner: if default-cascade is save-update or all, then cascade is all (0..1) or all-delete-orphan (many) otherwise cascade is delete.
If the property IS defined, it's value is generated at each occurence of a UML composition, and the inverse side is marked with cascade="none". The value must be a valid Hibernate cascade style. You should use a cascade value which includes delete to be conform with the UML concept of a composition, e.g. all-delete-orphan.

property.name: hibernateAggregationCascade
property.documentation:
Indicates how a UML aggregation should be interpreted as cascade. Possible values are are as follows:
If undefined, aggregation is not interpreted as a cascade value
If the property IS defined, its value is generated at each occurence of a UML aggregation, and the inverse side is marked with cascade="none". The value must be a valid Hibernate cascade style, e.g. all.

property.name: hibernateEntityDynamicInsert
property.documentation: Defines the default value dynamic-insert property on entities.

property.name: hibernateEntityDynamicUpdate
property.documentation: Defines the default value dynamic-update property on entities.

property.name: hibernateProxy
property.documentation: Defines if proxies will be enabled for Hibernate Entities.

property.name: hibernateQueryUseNamedParameters
property.documentation: Whether or not named parameters (i.e. ':someParameter') or unnamed (i.e. '?') parameters should be used in the HQL queries embedded within the model. NOTE: Does not apply to queries written in OCL.

property.name: hibernateInheritanceStrategy
property.documentation:
Defines the hibernate inheritance strategy (unless overridden on an entity level by the @andromda.hibernate.inheritance tagged value, can be the following possible values:
class - table per hierarchy.
subclass - table per class in hierarchy.
concrete - Table per class.
union-subclass - Table per class (Only Hibernate 3).
interface - Root class is defined as an interface and the attributes remapped to the subclasses. This is useful in the concrete case because it has limitations in the associations.

property.name: hibernateMappingStrategy
property.documentation:
Denotes whether or not subclasses should be mapped into the same .hbm.xml file or in a separate one.
Set this value to subclass when you want to have a mapping file per entity
The default is hierarchy which will render a mapping file per subclass

property.name: defaultEntityDiscriminatorColumn
property.documentation: The default name of the discriminator-column on the hibernate entity XML mapping.

property.name: defaultEntityDiscriminatorType
property.documentation: The default type of the discriminator-column of the hibernate entity XML mapping.

property.name: compositionDefinesEagerLoading
property.documentation: Allows you to turn on/off whether or not composite associations will define eager loading.

property.name: ejbViewType
property.documentation: If EJBs are being used, this specifies the default view type for the EJB interfaces. Can be either local or remote.

property.name: hibernateAssociationCollectionType
property.documentation: Used to define the default mapping for hibernate collections.

property.name: hibernateAssociationSortType
property.documentation: Used to define how elements will be sorted within the collection defined by the association. (Only available for maps and sets).

property.name: hibernateQueryUseSpecializedSetters
property.documentation: Defines if the finder setters method for parameters will use "setParameter" for all parameters (by default), or a specialized setter (setDate, setBoolean, etc.) in case the parameter type has it's own setter method.

property.name: versionProperty
property.documentation: The name of the property/attribute to automatically add to entities for versioning purposes. If this value is not specified or it contains only whitespace characters it will be ignored and the property will not be generated. This value can be overridden with the @andromda.hibernate.versiontagged value.

property.name: hibernateAssociationEndOuterJoin
property.documentation:
Defines the default outer join value for many to one and one to one association ends. Possible values are:
auto
true
false
For hibernate 3 the above values will be translated to
join
select

property.name: listTypeImplementation
property.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as lists.

property.name: setTypeImplementation
property.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as sets.

property.name: mapTypeImplementation
property.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as maps.

property.name: bagTypeImplementation
property.documentation: The implementation type to use for association ends that are modeled as bags.

property.name: specificCollectionInterfaces
property.documentation: A flag indicating whether or not specific collection interfaces will be used in association end mutators and accessors (i.e. java.util.Set, java.util.List, etc). If this is set to false, then the value of the defaultCollectionInterface property will used to provide the collection interface.

property.name: defaultCollectionInterface
property.documentation: The default collection interface, this is the interface used with association end accessors and mutators if the specificCollectionInterfaces flag is set to false.

property.name: associationEndCollectionIndexName
property.documentation: The default association end collection index name (this can be overridden by the @andromda.hibernate.collection.index).

property.name: associationEndCollectionIndexType
hibernateTypeMappingsUri
property.documentation: URI specifying the specific mappings from model types to hibernate types. (i.e. file:${basedir}/HibernateTypeMappings.xml). This is not necessary but useful for defining hibernate user types (when hibernate doesn't support a specific type in the manner needed for your application).

property.name: securityRealm
property.documentation: The name of the security realm (i.e. animal-quiz, other, etc). NOTE:This enables EJB security if specified.

property.name: userTypesPackage
property.documentation: Defines the package for the Hibernate user types

property.name: serviceLocatorName
property.documentation: The name to give to the generated service locator class.

property.name: hibernatePoolSize
property.documentation: Hibernate connection pool size.

property.name: hibernateJndiName
property.documentation: JNDI name bound to the SessionFactory.

property.name: xmlEncoding
property.documentation: Encoding for generated XML files.

property.name: generateEntityEqualsAndHashCode
property.documentation: Indicates whether or not a default equals and hashCode implementation should be generated.

property.name: hibernateQueryFactory
property.documentation:
Hibernate3 comes with a brand-new, ANTLR-based HQL/SQL query translator. However, it is still buggy and so in mean time use the Hibernate 2.1 query parser which is still available. Possible values are:
org.hibernate.hql.ast.ASTQueryTranslatorFactory (for the new query parser)
org.hibernate.hql.classic.ClassicQueryTranslatorFactory (for the old parser)

property.name: defaultServiceExceptionNamePattern
property.documentation: The pattern to use when constructing the default service exception name. NOTE: This propety is only applicable when defaultServiceExceptions is true.

property.name: defaultServiceExceptions
property.documentation: Whether or not to generate a default exception for each service. This exception will handle unexpected exceptions occuring within the implemented operations.

property.name: serviceInterceptors
property.documentation: Sets a list of default additional interceptors to be applied to service ProxyBeanFactory declarations. They will be listed after the serviceSecurityInterceptor, serviceTransactionInterceptor and hibernateInterceptor if present.

property.name: javaTypeConversionIgnoreList
property.documentation: A list of one or more fully qualified java types that should be ignored whenever a type conversion needs to be done. Currently, there is an issue with ValueObjects generated with the Java Axis mappings that causes Spring cartidge to generate DAO "entity to value object" type conversions incorrectly for all date types. By listing those date types here, the Spring cartridge will not attempt to auto-generate conversions for date/time related attributes.

property.name: actionFormScope
property.documentation:
The default scope in which the action's form attribute will be placed when the action is executing. Normally it doesn't make sense to change this value from the default, however you may occasionaly need to override this value using the @andromda.webflow.action.form.scope for a given action. The possible values are:
flash: Stores the object for the current and next request only. flash scope behaves similarly to the regular flash scope provided by controller actions. The main difference is that objects placed into flash scope within a flow must implement the java.io.Serializable interface flows differ from regular scopes such as session and request in that they store their state in a serialized, compressed form on the server. If you prefer a stateless server, you can instead store the state in the client by setting the grails.webflow.flow.storage property to client in grails-app/conf/Config.groovy
flow: Stores objects for the scope of the flow, removing them when the flow reaches an end state.
conversation: Stores objects for the scope of the conversation, including the root flow and nested subflows.

property.name: soapStack
property.documentation:
The soap stack to use for your webservices, valid values are:
axis
xfire
